alert.note: Alert for Brown (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 14 at 10:51AM CDT until May 18 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in the Twin Cities has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Minnesota... Cottonwood River Above Springfield affecting Brown County. .The Cottonwood River at Springfield gage appears to have gone bad, thus the observed stage is being ignored. Heavy rainfall over the past week should cause the river to reach Minor flood stage over the weekend. For the Cottonwood River...including Springfield, New Ulm...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO EARLY WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Cottonwood River Above Springfield. * WHEN...From late tonight to early Wednesday afternoon. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 930 AM CDT Saturday, the stage was 18.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tonight to a crest of 22.7 feet Monday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Tuesday evening. - Flood stage is 22.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 22.5 feet on 03/22/1978. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
